heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day was 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 11.4°C) and outside temperature (down 10.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 953 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 15.2°C), dew point temperature (up 9.8°C), outside temperature (up 12.5°C), and cloud levels (up 864 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 952.8m lower than yesterday, 354.5m lower than the past week, 864.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 928m minimum and 5160m maximum, with an average of 1581.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1936.0m and 2450m.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
